intro: Cissampelos crenata, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. It is often found growing in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
